# NSObjectProtocol

**Protocol**

The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview



An object that conforms to this protocol can be considered a first-class object. Such an object can be asked about its:

- Class, and the place of its class in the inheritance hierarchy.
- Conformance to protocols.
- Ability to respond to a particular message.

The Cocoa root class [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class] adopts this protocol, so all objects inheriting from [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class] have the features described by this protocol.

## Identifying Classes

- **superclass**: Returns the class object for the receiver’s superclass.

## Identifying and Comparing Objects

- **isEqual(_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver and a given object are equal.
- **hash**: Returns an integer that can be used as a table address in a hash table structure.
- **self()**: Returns the receiver.

## Testing Object Inheritance, Behavior, and Conformance

- **isKind(of:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of given class or an instance of any class that inherits from that class.
- **isMember(of:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is an instance of a given class.
- **responds(to:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver implements or inherits a method that can respond to a specified message.
- **conforms(to:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver conforms to a given protocol.

## Describing Objects

- **description**: A textual representation of the receiver.
- **debugDescription**: A textual representation of the receiver to use with a debugger.

## Sending Messages

- **perform(_:)**: Sends a specified message to the receiver and returns the result of the message.
- **perform(_:with:)**: Sends a message to the receiver with an object as the argument.
- **perform(_:with:with:)**: Sends a message to the receiver with two objects as arguments.

## Identifying Proxies

- **isProxy()**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver does not descend from [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class].

## Conforming Types

- NSObject
